bio:treatment.discussion: Schistidium confertum is one of the smaller species of the genus. It can be confused with S. dupretii and S. frigidum. Schistidium dupretii is distinguished by its consistently striate, larger, darker, and more cylindrical capsules and its oblate basal marginal laminal cells versus the quadrate or longitudinally short- rectangular marginal cells of S. confertum. Also, S. dupretii lacks the thicker transverse walls that characterize the basal marginal cells of S. confertum. The leaf margins of S. confertum are more weakly recurved than in S. dupretii, and it is usually olivaceous, often with yellowish or brownish tones, whereas S. dupretii is generally evenly brown.
